colleges.collegeName: College of Information and Computing Sciences

collegeProfile.history:
The College of Information and Computing Sciences is one of the premier colleges in the province for IT
                        Education and services. It aims to produce competitive IT professionals and IT-enabled individuals who
                        will encourage real innovation for the advancement in the digital era of the province and the country as a
                        whole. 
 
                        The college was established in 1998 at MSC Boac Campus through BOT Resolution No. 35, s. 1998 as
                        Institute of Information and Computing Sciences (IICS), a special program to offer Associate in Computer
                        Technology (ACT). Believing that the province needs IT Human Resources, after two years, IICS was
                        adopted as the School of Information and Computing Sciences (SICS), offering two emerging degree
                        programs Bachelor of Science in Information Management and Bachelor of Science in Information
                        Technology to cater to the graduates of ACT. Bachelor of Science in Information Management was also
                        offered in Sta. Cruz Campus. The Bachelor of Science in Information Management (BSIM) was renamed to
                        the Bachelor of Science in Information Systems (BSIS) to adapt to CHED Memorandum Order No. 53 series
                        of 2006.  
 
                        After a decade, the Marinduque State College had an organizational restructuring wherein two of the big
                        schools in the college were merged. The School of Industrial Technology and the School of Information
                        and Computing Sciences convergence paved the way for the School of Technology's birth in 2016. After
                        three years of being together, the two schools parted ways due to another organizational restructuring
                        and SICS was re-birth in 2019.  
 
                        In 2021, however, SICS was converted to the Institute of Information Systems and Technology (IIST) and
                        became part of the College of Engineering, Information and Industrial Technology (CEIIT) together with
                        the Institute of Engineering and Department of Industrial Technology to centralize the resources of these
                        three into a single college. But once again, fate has plans for this institute and let it navigate its ship on its
                        own. Finally, the former school was converted into a college, banning the name of the College of
                        Information and Computing Sciences (CICS).  
 
                        In 25 years of its existence, CICS has contributed significantly to MSC's mandates in Instruction, Research,
                        Extension, and Production. Currently, both the BS in Information Systems and BS in Information
                        Technology in Boac Campus are Level III Re-Accredited by the Accrediting Agency of Chartered Colleges
                        and Universities in the Philippines (AACCUP), while the BS in Information Systems in Sta. Cruz Campus is
                        Level II Re-Accredited. CICS has produced thousands of IT professionals serving in the province, other parts
                        of the country, and even the global industry. Faculty and students are also actively engaged in research
                        through various local and international presentations and publications. CICS also serves the community
                        by providing relevant extension projects and activities.  
 
                        For the years to come, CICS still commits to giving what their stakeholders deserve through quality
                        education and public service with their mantra, `WORK IN SILENCE AND LET OUR SUCCESS MAKE OUR
                        NOISE!`
collegeProfile.goals: To Produce competitive IT professionals and IT enabled individuals who will encourage real innovation for the advancement in the digital era of the province and the country as a whole.

awards.title: Best IT College in the Philippines
awards.description: Awarded by the Philippine IT Association for excellence in IT education.

programOffer.programName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology

international.title: Enhancing Examination Question Analysis: A Machine Learning Approach to Cognitive Level Prediction
Fern Edibility Classification of Two Fern Species in the Philippines Using Convolutional Neural Network
Landslide GIS Based Early Warning with Mobile Siren System for Incident Response Team
Multi-class Classification of Cyber Attacks with NSL-KDD: A Deep Learning Approach
Spotted!: ConvNet Based System for Identifying Missing Individuals
ICT Capacity Development Project of Barangay Newly Elected and Appointed Officials (BNEO)
international.facultyName: Dr. Maria Nessa M. Solomon, Beneden M. Logmao

extension.title: Development of and Implementation of an Online Wildlife Permitting and Management System
